Art. 4.228. 
Responsibility of the tutor
The tutor appointed for the execution is personally liable if he has not complied in all respects with the rules set out above for ascertaining the assets, for the sale of movables, for the use of cash, for transcription and registration and, in general, if he has not taken all the necessary steps to ensure that the duty of preservation is properly and faithfully discharged.
If the chargee is a minor, he may not, even in the event of the insolvency of his legal representative, be reimbursed for failure to comply with the rules prescribed for the tutor by the articles of this sub-title.
